News.Title: Parag Milk Foods Q3 FY26 Monitoring Agency Report
News.Summary: Parag Milk Foods submits monitoring agency report for Q3 FY26 showing utilization of ₹40.00 crores from preferential issue proceeds with ₹0.30 crores remaining unutilized.

News.Title: Parag Milk Foods Board Meet on Feb 4 for Q3 Results
News.Summary: Parag Milk Foods Limited has scheduled a board meeting on February 4, 2025, to consider Q3FY26 unaudited financial results. Trading window closed from January 1 to February 6, 2026.

News.Title: Parag Milk Foods Employee Exercises 20,000 Stock Options at Rs. 10 Each
News.Summary: An employee of Parag Milk Foods exercised 20,000 stock options at Rs. 10 per share under the company's Employee Stock Option Plan 2022. The Parag Milk Foods Employees Stock Option Trust transferred the equivalent equity shares to the option grantee's demat account.

News.Title: Sixth Sense India Opportunities-III Sells 21.47 Lakh Shares in Parag Milk Foods
News.Summary: Sixth Sense India Opportunities-III disposed of 21,47,587 equity shares of Parag Milk Foods Limited on November 14, 2025, through open market secondary sale, triggering a 2% change in shareholding since last disclosure. The sale reduced the fund's total holding from 7.10% to 5.06% of the company's issued capital, with the transaction being reported under SEBI takeover regulations.

News.Title: Parag Milk Foods Crosses INR 1,000 Crore Revenue Milestone in Q2 FY26
News.Summary: Parag Milk Foods achieved quarterly revenue of INR 1,008 crores for the first time, marking 16% year-on-year growth with 10% volume growth despite 16% milk price inflation. The company reduced consolidated net debt by INR 125 crores to INR 436 crores and reported 56% PAT growth, while core categories grew 14% in volume and new age business expanded 79% year-on-year.

News.Title: Parag Milk Foods Reports No Deviation in Preferential Issue Fund Utilization for September Quarter
News.Summary: Parag Milk Foods Limited submitted a monitoring agency report for the quarter ended September 30, 2025, regarding the utilization of funds raised through preferential issue of convertible share warrants on May 23, 2025. India Ratings Research Private Limited, serving as the monitoring agency, reported no deviation from the stated objects of the issue. The company had issued 90,00,000 convertible warrants at INR 179.10 per warrant, with total issue size of INR 161.19 crores. As of September 30, 2025, the company received INR 40.30 crores (25% upfront consideration). The funds are allocated for debt reduction (INR 17.50 crores), working capital (INR 7.80 crores), capital expenditure (INR 5.30 crores), and general corporate purposes (INR 9.70 crores). No utilization occurred during the quarter, with unutilized proceeds invested in fixed deposits with Jana Small Finance Bank and maintained in Union Bank of India account.

News.Title: Parag Milk Foods Corrects Cash Flow Statement in Q2 FY2025 Results
News.Summary: Parag Milk Foods Limited issued corrected unaudited standalone and consolidated financial results for the quarter and half year ended September 30, 2025. The company inadvertently included an older version of the Consolidated Statement of Cash Flows in its previously reported results. The corrected financial statements have been submitted to BSE and NSE exchanges. Additionally, the company allotted 67,99,719 equity shares of face value Rs 10 each at a conversion price of Rs 135 per share following the conversion of 10,680 Foreign Currency Convertible Bonds held by IFC on September 28, 2025.

News.Title: Parag Milk Foods Reports Record Q2 Revenue of Rs 1,008 Cr, PAT Grows 56% YoY
News.Summary: Parag Milk Foods Limited announced its highest ever quarterly revenue of Rs 1,008 crores for the quarter ended September 30, 2025, representing 16% value growth and 10% volume growth year-on-year. The company's Profit After Tax increased 56% to Rs 46 crores. For the half-year period, revenue reached Rs 1,859 crores with 14% value growth and 8% volume growth. Gross Profit Margin improved to 25.8% from 23.6% in the previous year. EBITDA grew 16% to Rs 89 crores with margin at 8.9%. The company reduced net debt by Rs 125 crores during the half-year, bringing consolidated net debt down from Rs 561 crores to Rs 436 crores. Core categories including Ghee, Cheese and Paneer witnessed 14% volume growth. The company converted Foreign Currency Convertible Bonds held by IFC, allotting 87,38,713 equity shares at Rs 135 per share. New age businesses Pride of Cows and Avvatar recorded 79% growth and now constitute 9% of overall business. The company handled an average of 14 lakh liters of milk per day during the quarter, with average milk prices at Rs 38 per liter.

News.Title: Parag Milk Foods Reports 56% Jump in Q2 Net Profit to 456.5M Rupees
News.Summary: Parag Milk Foods reported consolidated net profit of 456.5 million rupees in Q2, up from 292.1 million rupees in the same quarter last year. Revenue increased to 10.07 billion rupees from 8.71 billion rupees year-over-year. EBITDA rose to 712.4 million rupees compared to 603.6 million rupees in the previous year, while EBITDA margin improved to 7.07% from 6.93%.

News.Title: Parag Milk Foods Receives Rs 6.14 Lakh Penalty from Food Safety Authority
News.Summary: Parag Milk Foods Limited received penalty orders totaling Rs 6.14 lakh from the Food Safety and Standards Authority of India across two locations - Udaipur (Rs 1.14 lakh) and Lunawada (Rs 5 lakh). The penalties were imposed under section 51 of the Food Safety and Standards Act, 2006 for alleged substandard products versus standard specifications, though the products were deemed fit for consumption. The products were picked from retail stores. The company stated there is no material impact on operations or other activities and reserves the right to file appeals against the orders at appropriate forums.

News.Title: Parag Milk Foods Sets September 22, 2025 as Record Date for AGM Voting and ₹1 Dividend Eligibility
News.Summary: Parag Milk Foods Limited has set September 22, 2025 as the record date for determining shareholder eligibility for e-voting at the 33rd Annual General Meeting and for receiving a proposed dividend of ₹1 per equity share for the financial year ended March 31, 2025. The dividend represents a 10% payout on shares with a face value of ₹10 each and is subject to approval at the AGM. If approved, dividend payments will commence from September 29, 2025, with applicable tax deductions at source.

News.Title: Parag Milk Proposes Removal of GST on Paneer
News.Summary: Parag Milk has proposed the removal of Goods and Services Tax (GST) on paneer. The proposal suggests a possible elimination of GST on the dairy product.

News.Title: Parag Milk Foods Independent Director Nitin Dhavalikar to Step Down After Completing 10-Year Tenure
News.Summary: Nitin Dhavalikar will cease to be an Independent Director of Parag Milk Foods Limited on July 27, 2025, following the completion of his 10-year tenure consisting of two consecutive terms of 5 years each. He will also step down from his positions as Member or Chairperson of any Board committees. The company has expressed appreciation for his contributions, guidance and services during his tenure.

News.Title: Parag Milk Foods Reports 12% Revenue Growth to INR 852 Crores in Q1 FY26
News.Summary: Parag Milk Foods Limited delivered its highest ever first quarter revenue of INR 852 crores, marking a 12% year-on-year growth. The company's core categories of cheese, ghee and paneer grew 9% in volume and 14% in value, contributing 57% of total revenue. Gowardhan ghee maintains 22% market share in branded cow-ghee segment while Go cheese holds 35% market share. Despite average milk prices increasing 18% to INR 37 per litre, the company sustained margins and delivered 6% EBITDA growth with a margin of 7.7%. Gross profit margins improved sequentially from 25.1% in Q4 FY25 to 27.4% in Q1 FY26. The new age business, comprising Avvatar and Pride of Cows brands, now contributes 9% of total revenue compared to 6% last year, showing 57% year-on-year growth. Avvatar scaled eight times over the last three Q1s in the sports nutrition market. Daily milk procurement reached 16.5 lakh litres, marking a 10% increase over the previous quarter. The company targets reaching INR 10,000 crores revenue over the next five years.

News.Title: Parag Milk Foods Reports Strong Q1 Performance with Revenue Growth and Board Approvals
News.Summary: Parag Milk Foods Limited approved its quarterly results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, during a board meeting held on July 21, 2025. The company reported standalone revenue from operations of ₹898.69 crore compared to ₹830.52 crore in the previous quarter, with profit after tax of ₹32.43 crore versus ₹27.05 crore in the same quarter last year. On a consolidated basis, revenue reached ₹918.25 crore compared to ₹851.52 crore in the previous quarter. Basic earnings per share stood at ₹2.72 for standalone and ₹2.31 for consolidated results. The board also amended the company's insider trading policy and re-appointed Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu India LLP as internal auditor for financial years 2025-26 and 2026-27. The company operates in the milk and milk-related products segment and has subsidiaries including Bhagyalaxmi Dairy Farms Private Limited and Parag Foods Middle East FZE.

News.Title: Parag Milk Foods Plans Growth Through Core Category Expansion and New Age Brands
News.Summary: Parag Milk Foods has outlined its growth strategy focusing on expanding core categories and targeting a 39% compound annual growth rate (CAGR) in new age brands. The company plans to boost its direct-to-consumer (D2C) efforts while maintaining focus on strong profitability.

News.Title: Parag Milk Foods Reports Mixed Q1 Results with Revenue Growth and Margin Decline
News.Summary: Parag Milk Foods reported Q1 consolidated net profit of 276 million rupees compared to 273 million rupees in the previous year. Revenue increased to 8.52 billion rupees from 7.6 billion rupees year-over-year. EBITDA rose to 579 million rupees versus 562 million rupees in the same period last year, though EBITDA margin contracted to 6.8% from 7.41% year-over-year.

News.Title: Potential Discussions on Lowering GST Rates for Food Products
News.Summary: Discussions may begin on lowering GST rates for food products, potentially affecting Parag Milk Foods. The news suggests a possible reduction in Goods and Services Tax (GST) rates for certain food items, which could have implications for companies in the food industry.

News.Title: Parag Milk Foods: Q4 Revenue Soars to ₹918 Crore, Shares Jump 15%
News.Summary: Parag Milk Foods reported a 16.2% increase in Q4 revenue to ₹918.25 crore. Profit after tax surged 166.8% to ₹26.2 crore. EBITDA rose 67.7% to ₹62 crore, with margin expanding to 6.8%. The company implemented a ₹2 per litre price hike from May 1, 2025, due to rising costs.

News.Title: Parag Milk Foods to Consider Q4 Results on May 2
News.Summary: Parag Milk Foods has announced that it will consider its fourth quarter (Q4) financial results on May 2. This indicates the company is preparing to release its earnings report for the most recent fiscal quarter.

News.Title: Parag Milk Foods to Raise 1.61 Billion Rupees via Preferential Issue of Warrants
News.Summary: Parag Milk Foods has announced plans to raise 1.61 billion rupees (approximately $19.4 million USD) through a preferential issue of warrants. This corporate action is likely aimed at raising capital for the company's operations or expansion plans.

News.Title: Parag Milk Foods Allots 1.3 Million Warrants to Investor Utpal Hemendra Sheth
News.Summary: Parag Milk Foods has allocated 1.3 million warrants to investor Utpal Hemendra Sheth. This corporate action suggests a potential increase in investment or strategic partnership with the company.

News.Title: Parag Milk Foods Expands Product Portfolio with High-Protein Offerings
News.Summary: Parag Milk Foods has announced the strengthening of its product portfolio by introducing high-protein and nutrient-rich offerings. This move indicates the company's focus on meeting consumer demand for healthier food options and potentially expanding its market presence in the health-conscious segment.

News.Title: Parag Milk Foods Reports Improved Q3 EBITDA and Margin
News.Summary: Parag Milk Foods has announced its Q3 financial results, showing an increase in EBITDA to 737 million rupees from 628 million rupees year-over-year. The company's EBITDA margin also improved to 8.33% from 7.84% in the same period last year.

News.Title: Parag Milk Foods Reports Increased Q3 Profit and Revenue
News.Summary: Parag Milk Foods has announced its financial results for the third quarter. The company's consolidated net profit increased to 359 million rupees, up from 341 million rupees in the same period last year. Revenue also saw growth, rising to 8.85 billion rupees from 8 billion rupees year-over-year.

News.Title: Parag Milk Foods Reports Improved Q2 Financial Performance
News.Summary: Parag Milk Foods has announced its Q2 financial results, showing significant improvements in key metrics. The company's EBITDA (Earnings Before Interest, Taxes, Depreciation, and Amortization) increased to 692 million rupees, up from 528 million rupees in the same quarter last year. Additionally, the EBITDA margin improved to 7.94% from 6.62% year-over-year.

News.Title: Parag Milk Foods Reports Q2 Revenue Growth
News.Summary: Parag Milk Foods announced its second quarter revenue of 8.71 billion rupees, showing an increase from 7.98 billion rupees in the same quarter of the previous year.

News.Title: Parag Milk Foods Reports Q2 Profit Increase
News.Summary: Parag Milk Foods announced its Q2 consolidated net profit of 292.1 million rupees, showing an increase from 252 million rupees year-over-year and 273 million rupees quarter-over-quarter.
